trans-unit.source: Configuring Super Users for Azure Rights Management and Discovery Services or Data Recovery
trans-unit.target: Configuring Super Users for Azure Rights Management and Discovery Services or Data Recovery

trans-unit.source: The super user feature of Microsoft <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> (Azure RMS) ensures that authorized people and services can always read and inspect the data that Azure RMS protects for your organization.
trans-unit.target: The super user feature of Microsoft <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> (Azure RMS) ensures that authorized people and services can always read and inspect the data that Azure RMS protects for your organization.

trans-unit.source: And if necessary, remove the protection or change the protection that was previously applied.
trans-unit.target: And if necessary, remove the protection or change the protection that was previously applied.

trans-unit.source: A super user always has full owner rights for all use licenses that was granted by the organization’s RMS tenant.
trans-unit.target: A super user always has full owner rights for all use licenses that was granted by the organization’s RMS tenant.

trans-unit.source: This ability is sometimes referred to as “reasoning over data” and is a crucial element in maintaining control of your organization’s data.
trans-unit.target: This ability is sometimes referred to as “reasoning over data” and is a crucial element in maintaining control of your organization’s data.

trans-unit.source: For example, you would use this feature for any of the following scenarios:
trans-unit.target: For example, you would use this feature for any of the following scenarios:

trans-unit.source: An employee leaves the organization and you need to read the files that they protected.
trans-unit.target: An employee leaves the organization and you need to read the files that they protected.

trans-unit.source: An IT administrator needs to remove the current protection policy that was configured for files and apply a new protection policy.
trans-unit.target: An IT administrator needs to remove the current protection policy that was configured for files and apply a new protection policy.

trans-unit.source: Exchange Server needs to index mailboxes for search operations.
trans-unit.target: Exchange Server needs to index mailboxes for search operations.

trans-unit.source: You have existing IT services for data loss prevention (DLP) solutions, content encryption gateways (CEG), and anti-malware products that need to inspect files that are already protected.
trans-unit.target: You have existing IT services for data loss prevention (DLP) solutions, content encryption gateways (CEG), and anti-malware products that need to inspect files that are already protected.

trans-unit.source: You need to bulk decrypt files for auditing, legal, or other compliance reasons.
trans-unit.target: You need to bulk decrypt files for auditing, legal, or other compliance reasons.

trans-unit.source: By default, the super user feature is not enabled, and no users are assigned this role.
trans-unit.target: By default, the super user feature is not enabled, and no users are assigned this role.

trans-unit.source: It is enabled for you automatically if you configure the Rights Management connector for Exchange, and it is not required for standard services that run Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, or SharePoint Server.
trans-unit.target: It is enabled for you automatically if you configure the Rights Management connector for Exchange, and it is not required for standard services that run Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, or SharePoint Server.

trans-unit.source: If you need to manually enable the super user feature, use the Windows PowerShell cmdlet <link><linkText>Enable-AadrmSuperUserFeature</linkText><title></title></link>, and then assign users (or service accounts) as needed by using the <link><linkText>Add-AadrmSuperUser</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you need to manually enable the super user feature, use the Windows PowerShell cmdlet <link><linkText>Enable-AadrmSuperUserFeature</linkText><title></title></link>, and then assign users (or service accounts) as needed by using the <link><linkText>Add-AadrmSuperUser</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You can have one or multiple super users for your organization, but you must add individual users; groups are not supported.
trans-unit.target: You can have one or multiple super users for your organization, but you must add individual users; groups are not supported.

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet installed the Windows PowerShell module for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>, see <link><linkText>Installing Windows PowerShell for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet installed the Windows PowerShell module for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/>, see <link><linkText>Installing Windows PowerShell for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Security best practices for the super user feature:
trans-unit.target: Security best practices for the super user feature:

trans-unit.source: Restrict and monitor the administrators who are assigned a global administrator for your Office 365 or Azure RMS tenant, or who are assigned the GlobalAdministrator role by using the <link><linkText>Add-AadrmRoleBasedAdministrator</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Restrict and monitor the administrators who are assigned a global administrator for your Office 365 or Azure RMS tenant, or who are assigned the GlobalAdministrator role by using the <link><linkText>Add-AadrmRoleBasedAdministrator</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: These users can enable the super user feature and assign users (and themselves) as super users, and potentially decrypt all files that your organization protects.
trans-unit.target: These users can enable the super user feature and assign users (and themselves) as super users, and potentially decrypt all files that your organization protects.

trans-unit.source: To see which users and service accounts are assigned as super users, use the <link><linkText>Get-AadrmSuperUser cmdlet</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To see which users and service accounts are assigned as super users, use the <link><linkText>Get-AadrmSuperUser cmdlet</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Like all administration actions, enabling or disabling the super feature, and adding or removing super users are logged and can be audited by using the <link><linkText>Get-AadrmAdminLog</linkText><title></title></link> command.
trans-unit.target: Like all administration actions, enabling or disabling the super feature, and adding or removing super users are logged and can be audited by using the <link><linkText>Get-AadrmAdminLog</linkText><title></title></link> command.

trans-unit.source: When super users decrypt files, this action is logged and can be audited with <link><linkText>usage logging</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: When super users decrypt files, this action is logged and can be audited with <link><linkText>usage logging</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not need the super user feature for everyday services, enable the feature only when you need it, and disable it again by using the <link><linkText>Disable-AadrmSuperUserFeature</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: If you do not need the super user feature for everyday services, enable the feature only when you need it, and disable it again by using the <link><linkText>Disable-AadrmSuperUserFeature</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: The following log extract shows some example entries from using the Get-AadrmAdminLog cmdlet .
trans-unit.target: The following log extract shows some example entries from using the Get-AadrmAdminLog cmdlet .

trans-unit.source: In this example, the administrator for Contoso Ltd confirms that the super user feature is disabled, adds Richard Simone as a super user, checks that Richard is the only super user configured for Azure RMS, and then enables the super user feature so that Richard can now decrypt some files that were protected by an employee who has now left the company.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the administrator for Contoso Ltd confirms that the super user feature is disabled, adds Richard Simone as a super user, checks that Richard is the only super user configured for Azure RMS, and then enables the super user feature so that Richard can now decrypt some files that were protected by an employee who has now left the company.

trans-unit.source: 2015-08-01T18:58:20 admin@contoso.com GetSuperUserFeatureState Passed Disabled
trans-unit.target: 2015-08-01T18:58:20 admin@contoso.com GetSuperUserFeatureState Passed Disabled

trans-unit.source: 2015-08-01T18:59:44 admin@contoso.com AddSuperUser -id rsimone@contoso.com Passed True
trans-unit.target: 2015-08-01T18:59:44 admin@contoso.com AddSuperUser -id rsimone@contoso.com Passed True

trans-unit.source: 2015-08-01T19:00:51 admin@contoso.com GetSuperUser Passed rsimone@contoso.com
trans-unit.target: 2015-08-01T19:00:51 admin@contoso.com GetSuperUser Passed rsimone@contoso.com

trans-unit.source: 2015-08-01T19:01:45 admin@contoso.com SetSuperUserFeatureState -state Enabled Passed True
trans-unit.target: 2015-08-01T19:01:45 admin@contoso.com SetSuperUserFeatureState -state Enabled Passed True

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Scripting options for super users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Scripting options for super users

trans-unit.source: Often, somebody who is assigned a super user for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> will need to remove protection from multiple files, in multiple locations.
trans-unit.target: Often, somebody who is assigned a super user for <token href="../Token/aad_rightsmanagement_1_md.md"/> will need to remove protection from multiple files, in multiple locations.

trans-unit.source: While it’s possible to do this manually, it’s more efficient (and often more reliable) to script this.
trans-unit.target: While it’s possible to do this manually, it’s more efficient (and often more reliable) to script this.

trans-unit.source: To do so, <link><linkText>download the RMS Protection Tool</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To do so, <link><linkText>download the RMS Protection Tool</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Then, use the <link><linkText>Unprotect-RMSFile</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet, and <link><linkText>Protect-RMSFile</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet as required.
trans-unit.target: Then, use the <link><linkText>Unprotect-RMSFile</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet, and <link><linkText>Protect-RMSFile</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet as required.

trans-unit.source: Although the RMS Protection tool is designed for super users to bulk unprotect files for recovery purposes, the current version of the tool does not support user authentication for Azure RMS.
trans-unit.target: Although the RMS Protection tool is designed for super users to bulk unprotect files for recovery purposes, the current version of the tool does not support user authentication for Azure RMS.

trans-unit.source: Until this limitation is resolved, you must use a service principal account to authenticate with Azure RMS before you can remove protection from files.
trans-unit.target: Until this limitation is resolved, you must use a service principal account to authenticate with Azure RMS before you can remove protection from files.

trans-unit.source: For more information and instructions, see <link><linkText>about_RMSProtection_AzureRMS</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information and instructions, see <link><linkText>about_RMSProtection_AzureRMS</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these cmdlets, see <link><linkText>RMS Protection Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these cmdlets, see <link><linkText>RMS Protection Cmdlets</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The RMSProtection Windows PowerShell module that ships with the RMS Protection Tool is different from and supplements the main <link><linkText>Windows PowerShell module for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The RMSProtection Windows PowerShell module that ships with the RMS Protection Tool is different from and supplements the main <link><linkText>Windows PowerShell module for Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It supports both Azure RMS and AD RMS.
trans-unit.target: It supports both Azure RMS and AD RMS.

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configuring Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configuring Azure Rights Management</linkText><title></title></link>
